intro: Papaver nordhagenianum var. stefanssonii, commonly known as Stefansson's poppy, is a rare and endemic species native to specific regions of northern Scandinavia. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its striking, brightly colored flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subarctic environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
